declarations.description: Component for displaying an error message for a form control.
declarations.name: Error

members.name: size
members.description: The size at which the error is displayed.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size at which the error is displayed.

declarations.description: Mixin that adds form control functionality to a component.
declarations.name: FormControlMixin

members.name: errorText
members.description: An error text that will be shown over any other validation messages.

members.name: form
members.description: The form associated with the control.

members.name: hintText
members.description: A hint text that will be shown when there are no validation messages.

members.name: labels
members.description: The labels associated with the control.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the form control.

members.name: report
members.description: Whether the form control should report the validity of the control.

members.name: reportValidity
members.description:
Returns whether the control is valid. If the control is invalid, calling this will
also cause an `invalid` event to be dispatched. After calling this, the control
will also report the validity to the user.

members.name: setCustomValidity
members.description:
Sets a custom validation message for the form control. If the message
is not an empty string, that will make the control invalid. By setting it to
an empty string again, you can make the control valid again.

members.name: setFormControlElement
members.description:
This tells the mixin what the form control element is. This can either be a native input
or textarea element, or a Form Associated Custom Element (FACE) with an internals property.

The form control element must be either the same as the FormControlMixin host (in the case of
a FACE), or a child of it. Otherwise we can't link the validation message to the form control
element, which is necessary for accessibility.

members.name: showValidity
members.description: Whether to show the validity state.

members.name: updateValidity
members.description:
Updates the validity of the form control. This does not *change* the `validity` of the
form control, it just updates the display of any validation message. Changing the validity
is up to the form control itself.

NOTE: This method updates the `showValidity` property and therefore should be called from
`willUpdate`, never from `updated` or you will trigger a new lifecycle update.

members.name: valid
members.description: Returns whether the form control is valid or not.

members.name: validationMessage
members.description:
String representing a localized message that describes the validation constraints
that the control does not satisfy (if any). The string is empty if the control is
not a candidate for constraint validation, or it satisfies its constraints.

members.name: validity
members.description: Returns the validity state the control is in.

attributes.name: error-text
attributes.description: An error text that will be shown over any other validation messages.

attributes.name: hint-text
attributes.description: A hint text that will be shown when there are no validation messages.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the form control.

attributes.name: show-validity
attributes.description: Whether to show the validity state.

methods.name: reportValidity
methods.description:
Returns whether the control is valid. If the control is invalid, calling this will
also cause an `invalid` event to be dispatched. After calling this, the control
will also report the validity to the user.

methods.name: updateValidity
methods.description:
Updates the validity of the form control. This does not *change* the `validity` of the
form control, it just updates the display of any validation message. Changing the validity
is up to the form control itself.

NOTE: This method updates the `showValidity` property and therefore should be called from
`willUpdate`, never from `updated` or you will trigger a new lifecycle update.

methods.name: setCustomValidity
methods.description:
Sets a custom validation message for the form control. If the message
is not an empty string, that will make the control invalid. By setting it to
an empty string again, you can make the control valid again.

methods.name: setFormControlElement
methods.description:
This tells the mixin what the form control element is. This can either be a native input
or textarea element, or a Form Associated Custom Element (FACE) with an internals property.

The form control element must be either the same as the FormControlMixin host (in the case of
a FACE), or a child of it. Otherwise we can't link the validation message to the form control
element, which is necessary for accessibility.

fields.name: #errorElement
fields.description: The element containing the error message that is slotted into the `error` slot.

fields.name: #formControlElement
fields.description:
The actual element that integrates with the form; either
a Form Associated Custom Element, an `<input>` or a `<textarea>`.

fields.name: #hintElement
fields.description: The element containing the hint text that is slotted into the `hint` slot.

fields.name: report
fields.description: Whether the form control should report the validity of the control.

fields.name: form
fields.description: The form associated with the control.

fields.name: labels
fields.description: The labels associated with the control.

fields.name: valid
fields.description: Returns whether the form control is valid or not.

fields.name: validationMessage
fields.description:
String representing a localized message that describes the validation constraints
that the control does not satisfy (if any). The string is empty if the control is
not a candidate for constraint validation, or it satisfies its constraints.

fields.name: validity
fields.description: Returns the validity state the control is in.

declarations.description: Component for displaying a hint for a form control.
declarations.name: Hint

members.name: size
members.description: The size at which the hint is displayed.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size at which the hint is displayed.
